etymology.interpretation: Combines the ideas of entering and flesh to depict sexual penetration, yielding the vulgar verbal meaning “to fuck.” This is a purely semantic (idea-combining) graph rather than a sound-based formation.

examples.chinese: 别在公共场合说“肏”这个粗话(別在公共場合說「肏」這個粗話)。
examples.pinyin: Bié zài gōnggòng chǎnghé shuō “cào” zhège cūhuà.
examples.english: Don’t say the vulgar word “cào” in public.

examples.chinese: 他生气时会骂“肏”，但同事觉得很冒犯(他生氣時會罵「肏」，但同事覺得很冒犯)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shēngqì shí huì mà “cào”, dàn tóngshì juéde hěn màofàn.
examples.english: When he gets angry he curses “cào,” and his coworkers find it offensive.

examples.chinese: 作为感叹词，“肏”常用来表达愤怒或震惊(作為感嘆詞，「肏」常用來表達憤怒或震驚)。
examples.pinyin: Zuòwéi gǎntàncí, “cào” cháng yònglái biǎodá fènnù huò zhènjīng.
examples.english: As an interjection, “cào” is often used to express anger or shock.
